name: A Fully Faithful Functor is Conservative
comments: Proof: Let $F: C \to D$ be fully faithful. Suppose $F(f): F(X) \to F(Y)$ is an isomorphism in $D$. Since $F$ is fully faithful, the map $Hom_C(X,Y) \to Hom_D(F(X),F(Y))$ is a bijection, so there exists $g: Y \to X \in C$ such that $F(g)$ is the inverse of $F(f)$. By functoriality, $F(fg) = F(f)F(g) = id_{F(Y)}$ and $F(gf) = F(g)F(f) = id_{F(X)}$. Since $F$ is faithful, $fg = id_Y$ and $gf = id_X$, so $f$ is an isomorphism in $C$. Thus, $F$ reflects isomorphisms, i.e., is conservative.
